#Text=Marquette ( Michigan )
#Text=Marquette is a city in the Upper Peninsula ( U.P. ) of the state of Michigan .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Whenever talking to a Marquette resident , you 'll eventually hear reference to " the Lake " .
#Text=This nearly always means Lake Superior .
#Text=Other , smaller lakes nearby and elsewhere in the U.P. are referred to by their names , e.g. , Silver Lake , Teal Lake .
#Text=Marquette is a university town , and shares some sensibilities with other college towns around the country .
#Text=This also means that many , although by no means all , of the young adults are university students .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Sawyer International Airport ( MQT ) , ☏ +1-906-346-3308 .
#Text=A former U.S. Air Force base converted to civilian use .
#Text=Direct flights from Chicago , Detroit , and Minneapolis .
#Text=By bus
#Text=It is possible to take the Greyhound into Marquette .
#Text=By car
#Text=If you drive up from the Lower Peninsula , take US-2 along the southern shore of the U.P. for a scenic drive .
#Text=With a few local exceptions , all highways in the U.P. are 2-lane .
#Text=Passing lanes have been added along US-2 and M-28 , to help traffic flow .
#Text=Driving in the Upper Peninsula during winter can be treacherous , but the county crews do a good job of clearing , salting , and sanding the major roadways , as do the crews in Marquette .
#Text=Side streets can be very slippery if snow-covered .
#Text=By car
#Text=For the most part one would want to take a car , especially in winter when snow or ice covers everything .
#Text=By bicycle
#Text=In the summer you can rent bicycles from some of the local bike shops .
#Text=Marquette has several bike paths , one of which runs alongside the lake from Presque Isle Park to the intersection of M-28 and US-41 .
#Text=Biking on M-28 .
#Text=Additionally , the back roads around town are rather pleasant and the traffic is n't too harsh .
#Text=Lakeshore Bikes , 505 N Lakeshore Blvd , ☏ +1906 228-7547 .
#Text=has bike rentals available .
#Text=By bus
#Text=There is also county-wide bus service , which runs a few fixed routes and also offers door to door service .
#Text=See
#Text=Beaumier Heritage Center , Gries Hall , 7th St and Lee Dr.
#Text=DeVos Art Museum , Tracy & 7th Street .
#Text=Marquette Maritime Museum ( next to the Coast Guard station ) .
#Text=Tour the lighthouse while you 're here .
#Text=You must make an appointment beforehand .
#Text=Marquette Regional History Center , 145 W. Spring Street , ☏ +1-906-226-3571 .
#Text=M-T , Th - F 10AM-5PM W 10AM-8PM Sa 10AM-3PM .
#Text=Lake Superior .
#Text=You can view the lake at many spots around Marquette 's east side .
#Text=Iron ore boats in the Upper Harbor are a sight to behold ; you can see them docked at the Upper Harbor ore dock , next to Presque Isle Park during the upper Great Lakes shipping season .
#Text=Fall colors : In September and October , the forests are filled with a variety of reds , yellows and oranges as the maple , birch , aspen , and other leafed trees get ready for winter .
#Text=Arch and Ridge Streets Historic District .
#Text=Outdoors
#Text=Every winter this race is held and the start is immediately followed by fireworks off of the dock in downtown .
#Text=Paddling Michigan , ☏ +1-877-228-5447 .
#Text=offers kayak outings around the U.P. , including trips to Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore .
#Text=Skiing
#Text=Marquette Mountain .
#Text=offers several runs for alpine skiing , just south of Marquette 's city limits .
#Text=The Noquemanon Trail ( Cross Country Ski Race ) .
#Text=This race goes from Ishpeming to Marquette .
#Text=Hiking
#Text=Hiking opportunities are abundant , with many hikes heading up the big hills in the area that overlook the lake .
#Text=One can hike up Sugarloaf Mountain or Hogback Mountain and then hike back down to the Lake for a relaxing lounge on the beach .
#Text=For additional trails , not yet listed here , see City of Marquette 's list public trails on its website .
#Text=Sugarloaf Mountain .
#Text=This is a good , short hike north of town .
#Text=Two routes are maintained : one route is a steeper climb , and the other ascends more gradually .
#Text=Both routes include staircases over rock outcroppings , especially near the summit .
#Text=The view from the top is spectacular - a great photo spot .
#Text=Also one of the best places for autumn foliage viewing .
#Text=Presque Isle Park .
#Text=A city-owned area with boat slips , picnic areas , trails , a sheltered pavilion , and a refreshment shop .
#Text=Presque Isle Park is flanked by the Upper Harbor to the south , and by Lake Superior to the east and north , and northwest .
#Text=It 's a city park but feels much bigger .
#Text=The trail around the perimeter of the island meanders through the woods , occasionally popping out for breathtaking views of cliffs and the lake .
#Text=Presque Isle Park is found by following Lake Shore Drive northward , just past the north harbor ore dock .

#Text=The refreshment shop is closed in the winter , as is the one-lane , one-way road around the " Island , " as the park is known locally , but remains open to snow-showing , cross-country skiing , and hiking in the winter months .
#Text=Biking
#Text=Marquette has challenging trails for freeride mountain biking .
#Text=Follow the bike path from Presque Isle Park , all the way to south Marquette .
#Text=This path was added within the last 10 years or so , and has become very popular .
#Text=Just be prepared to share it with pedestrians and the occasional rollerblader .
#Text=Oar to Shore ( mountain bike race ) .
#Text=In the summer , Marquette is host to the Ore to Shore mountain bike race .
#Text=For good riding advice , stop by Lakeshore Bikes or the Quick Stop Bike Shop .
#Text=Guys at both shops are avid riders and will be happy to point you in the right direction .
#Text=Fishing
#Text=You can fish Lake Superior , the inland lakes , and many creeks and streams .
#Text=Licensing , minimum length of caught fish , and fish limits are regulated by the Michigan DNR , which publishes a fishing guide .
#Text=Uncle Ducky 's Charter Fishing , 434 East Prospect St , ☏ +1-877-228-5447 .
#Text=Fishing trips on Lake Superior .

#Text=Otherwise you can fish off of the breakwall downtown , which is accessible from the Coast Guard station off of Lakeshore Drive ( just north of downtown ) , or one of the inland lakes and streams .
